perturbation.original_text: For purposes of this Agreement, Client's Competitors means those merchants identified in Exhibit D attached hereto. Client may update 2 CONFIDENTIAL MATERIALS OMITTED AND FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. ASTERISKS DENOTE OMISSIONS. this list in writing not more than once every six (6) months by adding other merchants whose primary business is reselling Vitamins upon the mutual agreement of Excite.
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of this Agreement, Client's Competitors means those merchants identified in Exhibit D attached hereto. Client may update this list in writing with Excite's approval.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific timeframe for updating the list of competitors (once every six months), and replacing 'not more than once every six months' with a general statement that updates require Excite's approval, we introduce uncertainty. The original text limits the number of times that Client may update the list of competitors. The new change does not address the question of how often the client may change the list, and if there are requirements for how many competitors are on that list.

perturbation.original_text: All such message campaigns will comply with Excite's then current privacy policy which is located at http://www.excite.com/privacy_policy and is subject to change from time to time. If the privacy policy changes in a manner that has a material adverse effect on the value, functionality or implementation of the DeliverE message campaign for Client, Excite will notify Client, which will then have the option to cancel future DeliverE campaigns and both parties will be relieved of their obligations related to those canceled DeliverE campaigns, if Client, in its sole but reasonable discretion, finds such changed privacy policy objectionable.
perturbation.changed_text: All such message campaigns will comply with Excite's then current privacy policy which is located at http://www.excite.com/privacy_policy and is subject to change from time to time. If the privacy policy changes, Excite will notify Client.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause that defines the recourse available to the client in the event that Excite changes the privacy policy, specifically, the option to cancel future DeliverE campaigns without obligation, the modified text creates an inconsistency. The original text gives a specific right to the Client, which is then removed, causing uncertainty on what the rights and obligations of the parties are.

perturbation.original_text: Excite guarantees to deliver the annual impressions totals set forth in Exhibit C hereto. If Excite fails to deliver the indicated number of impressions required during any annual period, Client may suspend (but not eliminate) its payments specified in Section 7 for a maximum of sixty (60) days (the "Make-Good Period) during which Excite will deliver the shortfall of such impressions. The parties agree to cooperate in good faith to evaluate the quality and performance of the placements used to deliver the impressions during the Make-Good Period. Until such shortfall is delivered, no impressions will be deemed delivered for the next annual period. If Excite has not achieved the required annual impression delivery by the end of the Make-Good Period, Client may then terminate this Agreement upon written notice within ten (10) days following the end of the Make-Good Period. Client's termination of the Agreement in accordance with the previous sentence will not relieve Excite of its obligation to deliver any previously paid for but undelivered impressions. If Excite achieves the annual impression delivery goal at any time during the Make-Good Period, the term of this Agreement will continue and Client shall immediately resume payment of the sponsorship and advertising fees specified in Section 7.
perturbation.changed_text: Excite guarantees to deliver the annual impressions totals set forth in Exhibit C hereto. If Excite fails to deliver the indicated number of impressions required during any annual period, Client may suspend (but not eliminate) its payments specified in Section 7. The parties agree to cooperate in good faith to evaluate the quality and performance of the placements used to deliver the impressions. If Excite achieves the annual impression delivery goal, the term of this Agreement will continue.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definition of the "Make-Good Period" and the specific repercussions if Excite does not deliver annual impressions, the modified text creates uncertainty. The original text defines how the parties should act, and what the consequences should be in the event that Excite fails to meet its impression goals. By removing this section, there is no longer a period defined for the actions to take place.
